title: Mass. senators push bill that could allow residents to sue ICE agents
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Massachusetts Senate introduces a bill allowing lawsuits against federal officers for constitutional rights violations.
The bill is part of "Response 2025," addressing Trump's immigration policy, with focus on holding federal law enforcement accountable.
Lawsuits could be filed in state or federal courts, aiming for liability over civil rights infringements without targeting specific statutes.

title: Six arrested in Springfield drug and gun trafficking busts
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: Six arrested in Springfield, Massachusetts, in a crackdown on drug and gun trafficking rings by Massachusetts State Police.
Operations led to seizure of 15 handguns, six rifles, 11 magazines, 8.5 kg of cocaine, and 30,000 bags of fentanyl.
Approximately $63,000 in cash was confiscated during the joint operations with multiple law enforcement agencies, including the FBI.

title: Dropkick Murphys cut ties with Wasserman agency after CEO’s name appears in Epstein files
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: Dropkick Murphys ended relationship with Wasserman agency after Casey Wasserman was linked to Epstein files.
Emails between Casey Wasserman and Ghislaine Maxwell were included in DOJ-released Epstein files from January.
Wasserman remains LA28 Board Chair despite calls for resignation due to past Epstein-Maxwell interactions.

title: Video: Water pours into South Station from newly renovated ceiling
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: A damaged sprinkler line caused water to pour into South Station's newly renovated concourse on Thursday.
The MBTA quickly addressed the incident and completed cleanup by the end of the day, avoiding train service disruptions.
The contractor involved was working on the South Station tower development by Hines Development.

title: Did you follow the local news this week? Take our Greater Boston news quiz.
author: Peter Chianca
bullets: Boston.com offers a news quiz to test knowledge on recent Greater Boston stories.
Peter Chianca is the general assignment editor at Boston.com since 2019.
The quiz focuses on trending topics such as local events and notable figures in Greater Boston.

title: MBTA Hingham ferry service canceled for Feb. 13 due to ice in the harbor
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: MBTA cancels all Hingham/Hull ferry service for Feb. 13 due to ice in Boston Harbor.
Shuttle buses will operate from Nantasket Beach to Hull Ferry Terminal starting 6:30 a.m.
Recent snowstorm caused thicker ice, resulting in unusual ferry cancellations this winter.

title: Retired Gloucester firefighter dies days after being struck by Lowell police cruiser
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Retired Gloucester firefighter Daniel Kennedy was fatally struck by a Lowell police cruiser at UMass Lowell on February 5.
Kennedy, 60, a Desert Storm veteran and recent student, died from his injuries at Lahey Hospital nearly a week later.
The incident is under investigation by the Middlesex District Attorney’s Office and Massachusetts State Police.

title: 5 players on Red Sox’ roster bubble entering spring training
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Triston Casas may start 2026 with Triple-A Worcester due to health issues and lack of a starting role.
Kristian Campbell may begin in Triple-A due to defensive limitations and competition for Boston's DH position.
Pitchers Payton Tolle and Connelly Early likely to start season in Worcester given Boston's pitching depth.

title: Plans confirmed for new ICE facility in N.H.; documents reveal state officials knew for weeks
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: State documents show New Hampshire officials knew about a planned ICE facility in Merrimack by January 12, 2026.
Governor Kelly Ayotte's administration faced internal discord, leading to DNCR Commissioner Sarah Stewart's resignation over the ICE facility plans.
The Merrimack ICE facility will cost $158 million to renovate and house 400-600 detainees, with operation costs of $146 million first three years.

title: Ex-Patriots coach Dante Scarnecchia isn’t panicking over Will Campbell’s play
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots left tackle Will Campbell struggled in the Super Bowl, allowing 14 pressures against the Seahawks defense.
Ex-Patriots coach Dante Scarnecchia supports keeping Campbell at left tackle despite season-ending struggles and injury setbacks.
Terron Armstead offers offseason training assistance to Campbell to address his technical issues and improve his performance.
